entry.title: Re: Terminate debug session button disappeared from the Debug Perspective toolbar

entry.title: Re: User ID for IAS users
entry.content: Strangely enough for example IAG does require the UserID (P-number) which is giving a lot of issues downstream. I don't think SAP really knows the direction they are going in, a lot of products don't support the global user ID. But yes, for AI it seems to be required.

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd in 2025
entry.content:
Hey Everyone!

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are now in full swing at SAP!

SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, tech visionaries, innovators, and leaders eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP‚Äôs solutions, platforms, and technologies, along with insights into their future direction. It also offer an opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

In 2025, SAP TechEd goes hybrid, kicking off with parallel events in Berlin, Louisville, and online ‚Äì followed by SAP TechEd on Tour stops in Australia, India, UK, and Germany for a unique opportunity for an in-depth, in-person learning experience. Except for the Berlin and Bangalore stops, the on-site events are organized in partnership with, and hosted by, SAP User Groups and SAPinsider. 

The choice is yours: join us on-site in Berlin or Louisville (at ASUG Tech Connect), or online for the first events in the series! 

Save the date and register now!
üìÖNovember 4 - 6, 2025
Berlin | Online (free) | Louisville

ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd in 2025

üîß What to Expect

ABAP continues to evolve, and SAP TechEd events in 2025 are the best place to see what‚Äôs next. Beyond the integration of ABAP Cloud into SAP Build announced last year, and the integration of SAP Joule for Developers into the ABAP development tools along with the ABAP AI SK to infuse AI into your business processes earlier this year,  you‚Äôll have the opportunity to explore the latest innovations and updates in ABAP Cloud, AI-based custom code transformation, clean core practices, and the new clean core levels approach for SAP S/4HANA extensibility in both the private cloud and on-premise.

üí° Why Attending ABAP Sessions Matters

  • Get a clear direction for your ABAP strategy, whether you're on ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP BTP
  • Learn how to modernize custom development without touching the core
  • See how SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities can support faster, cleaner development
  • Take home practical skills for RAP, testing, ABAP Test Cockpit, governance, and more

Access the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual | ASUG Tech Connect.

üìåABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 

üìÖ Event Info: 

  • Dates: November 4‚Äì6, 2025
  • Location: Messe Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
  • Session formats: Strategy talks, roadmap updates, deep dives, community talks, and hands-on workshops
  • 9 Content tracks: ABAP sessions primarily in the tracks "Application Development & Automation (AD)" and "Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP (DT)" 

üé§Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there‚Äôs a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let‚Äôs get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles. 

üéØStrategy Talks (25 minutes)

ST109 ‚Äì SAP Build: ABAP Cloud Strategy | also available virtually as ST119v
The ABAP Cloud strategy as part of SAP Build and the SAP strategy go hand-in-hand. Explore in this session what this means for our major topics ABAP AI and Custom Code Transformation and how we integrate Business Data Cloud. Furthermore, learn about the ABAP IDE strategy and how we support the sovereign cloud.
Speakers: Sonja Lienard (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

ST113 ‚Äì Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore the strategy for extensibility across SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

üó∫Ô∏è Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 ‚Äì SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 ‚Äì Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

üîçDeep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 ‚Äì Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 ‚Äì Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP‚Äîfully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital‚Äôs journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), External Speaker

AD201 ‚Äì Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 ‚Äì Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 ‚Äì Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

üõ†Ô∏è Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 ‚Äì Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 ‚Äì Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Bra√ºninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 ‚Äì Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default ‚Äì on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), J√ºrgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 ‚Äì Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Br√§uninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 ‚Äì Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Br√§uninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 ‚Äì Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

üëãJoin Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) ‚Äì or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! ü§ù  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the üî•ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! ü§ù

Stay tuned ‚Äì and see you there!

entry.title: Re: They are going to have a lot of money on it is not a...
Re: The way to be in FM and and I am so proud to be a new...
Headers missing from CAP request in handler
entry.content:
Hi All!

I'm working on a CAP service that serves content to both an HTML5 app and an MDK app. I've created a handler to pre-filter some data according to the user ID. If the user is logged in using the MDK app, I want to detect this using the header' x-forwarded-path', which should be included in the request (I implemented this in another project successfully).

But this time, using CAP 8.9.2, I see only the x-correlation-id header in any request; a lot is missing. I saw some posts about missing authorisation headers, but not all the other headers (x-*** for example). 

My packages:

    "@sap/cds": "^8.9.2",
    "@sap/cds-dk": "^8.9.1",
    "@sap/xsenv": "^5.5.0",
    "@sap/xssec": "^4.6.0",

Has anyone here been through this before?

Thanks!

entry.title: How to configure automatic Good Receipt for a Condition Value of Total Order Amount?
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to configure automatic goods receipts in SAP Ariba for a client that demands setting up the Automatic receiving for different Total Order Amount values threshold for different company codes.

I have put the following fields in the Condition Value 1 - Requisition.TotalCost.Amount AND Requisition.CompanyCode.UniqueName in Condition Value 2 fields.

However, how do I configure in the Excel (ReceiptByCommodityCode.csv) that the Total Amount of the PR should be less than this value that I put in this column?

entry.title: How to relay custom headers in SAP CALM alerts and pass them to Snow Inc for business users?
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I am trying to leverage the custom header details passed from Integration suite in the SAP CALM alerts.We are trying to create snow incidents for all the alerts generated from SAP CALM but instaed of just sending technical errors ,we need to send business data e.g. Sales order number,PO numbers etc for business users to track the failed orders in the system.
Is there a way to acheive this?

Thanks,

Indu Khurana

entry.title: SAP User Experience in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Every successful business knows that an exceptional user experience is the crown jewel of their operations. Not only does it enhance efficiency and productivity, but it also fosters customer satisfaction, ultimately leading to sustained growth and success in the competitive market. 

The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release introduces a range of innovative enhancements, tailored to refine user interactions and optimize business processes with the help of artificial intelligence. Let's dive into these user experience highlights that will make your business shine. 

TLDR? Check out this video made by my digital twin to get an overview of my highlights:

 


Joule for business 

Speaking of jewels, SAP‚Äôs very own AI co-pilot, Joule, introduces advanced intelligent assistance to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, allowing business users to engage with their systems using natural language for quicker and more impactful results. By integrating artificial intelligence within the system, Joule serves as a digital assistant, revolutionizing the way users navigate and utilize business applications. It eliminates technical obstacles by understanding user intent and providing contextually relevant outcomes through intuitive, conversational interactions. 

Joule for consultants 

Joule for consultants is specifically designed to speed up project delivery by offering instant access to a unique, expertly curated SAP knowledge base. This includes over 200,000 pages of documentation and content from SAP communities, helping consultants find answers quickly and saving up to 1.5 hours daily. It also features SAP-specific code intelligence, reducing code interpretation time by up to 40%. Overall, Joule can accelerate project timelines by up to 14%, cutting a typical 12-to-18-month project by 1.5 to 2.5 months. 

 

Joule for developers 

Joule for developers is integrated within the ABAP development tools to enhance productivity by aiding in faster code writing, testing, and delivery for ABAP Cloud. For environments like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, it reduces development time and effort, speeding up value realization. Key features include predictive code completion, a chat feature for natural language queries, code explanation, and support for generating and improving ABAP unit tests and test classes for CDS entities, ensuring reliable applications. 

Design updates for SAP Business Suite consistency 

Navigation has become more seamless than ever with a newly designed navigation menu that removes the extra click previously needed to reach My Home. Users can now effortlessly access their favorite apps and folders from anywhere within the platform, enhancing efficiency. Additionally, personalization through "All Spaces" further improves ease of use. The introduction of the new shell bar maximizes vertical space while prominently displaying the product name. This update needs to be activated using "/UI2/SHELL_BAR_TOGGLE." Please note that adjustments may be necessary for automated testing. The user menu has been overhauled for greater intuitiveness, featuring larger images, improved spacing, and an easily accessible sign-out button. Notifications have also been refined for better management, allowing users to sort by date or importance with clear categories such as "Today" and "Yesterday." Finally, visual enhancements in Search and Error handling bring a modern touch to the interface, providing users with a smoother and more guided experience. 

Recap feature on My Home 

Moving on to user-centric improvements, the Recap feature is all set to transform how business users stay updated with their My Home enhancements. With a focus on saving time, this intelligent feature highlights the changes since the user‚Äôs last login by comparing current data with the past 24 hours. It brings tasks needing attention right to the forefront, streamlining decision-making and increasing productivity by allowing users more time for strategic work. 

Manage News app on My Home 

Meanwhile, the Manage News app strikes at the heart of timely communication. It centralizes internal messages and key updates by enabling the creation and dissemination of news articles directly on My Home. Here, administrators can control visibility, categorization, and the targeted audience of news content, facilitating consistent and streamlined communication across teams. This leads to greater connectivity and informed decision-making within the workforce. 

 AI-assisted UX features

In my last blog post, I introduced some of our AI-assisted UX features, which aim to enhance user interactions by making them more intuitive and efficient through AI-driven capabilities. With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release, these AI-assisted UX features are now generally available! We structure them in base features and premium features: 

  • Base features:
    1. AI-assisted enterprise search (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Users can access business data efficiently via natural language queries, enhancing productivity and user experience. Enabling this search feature allows employees to dig through data with queries such as ‚ÄúShow me sales orders in overall status in process" or "Show me open sales orders that have a net value greater than 100 EUR‚Äù, offering seamless data discovery.


       
    2. AI-assisted easy filter (available through limited promotion in 2502 release): This feature elevates your user experience by allowing filters through natural language, reducing time spent on manual input. Users can enjoy intuitive interactions and explore complex filters with criteria such as currency or date range all supported by generative AI. Access to recent and favorite queries further optimizes user interactions. 


    3. AI-assisted smart summarization (also available through limited promotion in 2502 release): It simplifies data presentation through rich text summaries of object pages. This allows for better business data understanding and efficient sharing across productivity platforms, ensuring smooth collaboration between co-workers and customers. 

       


Kick start your AI journey as an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition customer or partner by using the base AI-assisted features at no additional costs. The only required action from your side is the acceptance of SAP AI terms for base AI-assisted features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (by one S-user of your company). Afterwards, we will reach out to you with a confirmation of the activation and send over the required, minimal, ‚Äúlast mile configuration‚Äù on your side. 

  • Premium features:
    1. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for insights cards (available through beta testing in 2502 release): Personalizing your My Home receives a smart upgrade through generative AI, adding insights cards directly with a mere click. It supports various SAP Fiori applications, offering previews for data consistency ensuring quality. 

       


And, as we cannot get enough of our AI-assisted UX, we have some more features waiting for you in beta testing in this release as well! 

  • AI-assisted smart solutions for situations on My Home: This feature enhances task efficiency by intelligently adapting the interface for rapid situation resolution. Leveraging AI-driven insights directly from the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition homepage, users gain easy access to essential information and actionable steps. This innovation fosters a seamless user experience, reducing the time and effort required for decision-making.

      
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications: You can leverage AI to efficiently incorporate applications through natural language instructions. It allows users to preview and select AI-recommended applications swiftly, significantly enhancing the setup process. This feature is particularly useful for new users, making their interaction with the platform smoother and more intuitive.


  • AI-assisted easy fill: This innovation revolutionizes form completion by using natural language input to automatically map text to appropriate fields, minimizing navigation time and errors. This results in improved accuracy and efficiency in data entry, as users can maintain focus and streamline processes without tedious form-checking. 


  • AI-assisted error explanation: This feature aids in understanding and solving errors within SAP Fiori applications by delivering AI-generated resolution suggestions embedded within the error messages. This facilitates quicker problem-solving and enhances user understanding, particularly for newer users needing guidance on error resolution. 

Our beta testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers early access to new features and innovations, allowing users to experience enhancements firsthand and give feedback to shape the final product. Participants play a key role in influencing development to ensure it meet practical business needs, creating a collaborative link between developers and users for continuous improvement. Want to be part of this journey? Sign up for the beta testing here: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#campaign/3910  

Collaborative ERP: To-Dos in Microsoft Teams 

Speaking of collaboration, the To-Dos functionality within Microsoft Teams gives users the ability to receive notifications of new tasks directly within their activity feed, enhancing responsiveness and efficiency. This integration facilitates seamless approval processes, allowing end-users to act on situations swiftly, whether it be within Microsoft Teams or directly through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. This aims to streamline workflows, support decision-making based on real-time data, and improve team connectivity by centralizing task management within familiar interfaces.

These enhancements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 are designed not only to transform but also to ignite the user experience, bringing an elegant polish to the platform that goes beyond traditional bounds. 

Find out more about SAP User Experience in this blog series by Thomas Reiss. 

Want to learn more about Artificial Intelligence? Check out these blog posts by Yannick Peterschmitt and Sang Dao. Refer to this document for more information. 

üìΩÔ∏è Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!‚ÄØ 

From July 21-25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for SAP User Experience as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand‚Äìanywhere, anytime.‚ÄØ 

üîé Find all our assets‚ÄØ 

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:‚ÄØ

entry.title: Is there any provision available in Cloud to keep track of Unloading/Loading activities?
entry.content:
As per the Business requirement, we need to keep track of Unloading/Loading activities during Inbound/Outbound operations within EWM.

We don't see any provision in Cloud as we have in On-prem, could you please check and let us know if there are any possible approaches followed to fit this requirement into EWM.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Is there any provision available in Cloud to keep tra...
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, we have some limitations comparing with On prem system on the tracking of loading and unloading. However, there are some approaches that I would like to share in case could be helpful for your business:

1. Advanced Shipping and Receiving Process
The Advanced Shipping and Receiving process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud allows for integrated, end-to-end tracking of unloading and loading activities. This process supports mixed and multi-warehouse scenarios within one freight order, coordinating steps from the arrival of trucks at the gate to the final goods movement in the warehouse.

2. Handling Execution Status
You can set handling execution statuses such as ‚ÄòArrived‚Äô, ‚ÄòChecked In‚Äô, ‚ÄòChecked Out‚Äô, and ‚ÄòDeparted‚Äô for transportation stages and locations. These statuses help track the progress of unloading and loading activities.

3. Warehouse Management Integration
Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud provides real-time transparency into managing and processing material movements. You can map your warehouse in detail, down to storage bin level, and plan and perform movements within the warehouse, including goods receipt and goods issue.

4. Use of Unloading Points
Unloading points can be specified in the customer master record, allowing you to schedule goods receiving hours and propose delivery dates based on the customer‚Äôs factory calendar and goods receiving schedule.

5.  Loading Using Radio Frequency

In Advanced Shipping and Receiving, you can also process loading activities using a radio frequency device (RF device), with loading by delivery, loading by door and loading by freight order.

For more detailed processes and configurations, you may refer to the SAP documentation on Warehouse Management and Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

Transportation Management (TM) - Warehouse Integration
Load Freight Orders in Advanced Shipping and Receiving
Warehouse Management - Warehouse Management
Loading Instruction
Master Data - Unloading Points
Loading Using Radio Frequency
In case those options are not enough for your business or there is something specific on the on prem system that you requires in the Public Cloud system, we truly recommend raising this request to our product owners by a feature request in our SAP Influence Portal (##2963059 - How to Submit Feature Requests for SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Product).

entry.title: Re: They are so many people who have to do it again and I...
Driving Resilience Through Intelligent Supply Chain Orchestration
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs global economy, supply chains are under greater pressure than ever before. Shifting trade regulations, evolving geopolitical landscapes, labor shortages, and rising customer expectations are driving unprecedented complexity. Many organizations are realizing that traditional, siloed approaches to supply chain management are no longer enough to remain competitive‚Äîor to simply keep pace with disruption.

The stakes are high: one weak link can set off ripple effects across operations, manufacturing, logistics, and customer delivery. For businesses that rely on complex supplier networks and face unpredictable market dynamics, resilience can‚Äôt be an afterthought, it must be designed into the supply chain itself.

That‚Äôs where supply chain orchestration comes in. Rather than focusing on isolated improvements within functional areas, orchestration integrates processes, data, and decision-making across the entire value chain. With the right strategy, companies can transform supply chains from reactive networks into connected ecosystems that anticipate shifts, adapt rapidly to disruptions, and deliver on customer promises.

To help you explore how orchestration creates more effective and future-ready supply chains, SAP, HP, and Accenture are hosting a  webinar designed for supply chain and operations leaders.

The session will showcase the opportunities orchestration brings to organizations across industries, and offer practical ways to:

  • Improve agility and mitigate disruption with aligned, end-to-end processes
  • Enhance visibility and execution for faster, smarter, AI-supported decisions
  • Strengthen coordination with suppliers and partners while building a foundation for scalable, proactive operations

Join my guests:

  • Antoine Colin, Senior VP, Supply Chain Transformation and Resilience, HP
  • Sid Gudal, Managing Director, Partner, Accenture
  • Sudy Bharadwaj, Global VP, Strategic Engagements, Intelligent Spend and Business Networks SAP

Driving Resilience Through Intelligent Supply Chain Orchestration

Tuesday, September 02, 2025

entry.title: Re: üîê Strengthening SAP BTP Security: SSO with Cloud Connector Using Token-Based Auth (Replacing SU
entry.content:
Hi @MatthiasL ,

Considering below scenarios:

  • Segregation of Duties and restricted privileges to different teams. If you see the screenshots, you will observe that i am using Trust Config "Custom Identity provider for Applications" - IAS for authentication, What it means is It's a subaccount level trust configuraiton (Not the Platform SSO). Which implies that the user CloudConnectorAdmin which i used will never be able to login to BTP cockpit and see the configurations in BTP subaccount ->cloud connector section to download the authentication data file. 
    • Permissions(cloud connector administrator) are also provided against this identity provider only. Even if let's say some customer has platform SSO enabled and luckily same user is used to login to BTP cockpit. Subaccount will still not be visible because of the permissions which are granted on Custom IDP for Apps and not on Platform SSO IDP(which will be used to login to BTP).
    • We can restrict privileges of users to perform specific tasks. In this scenario CloudConnectorAdmin can perform the connectivity , renew certificates and still don't have any access in BTP subaccount(because it can't login using these creds to BTP)..
  • This option was introduced in Cloud Connector 2.17.0  version. There are a lot of customers using older versions of cloud connector and don't have this option.

However its a valid point and this option also helps avoiding SUSER ID option so i have updated the blog with a small section to show this option as well - "Configure using authentication data from file"

Regards

Sushil Gupta

entry.title: Error occurred while integrating SAP GRDC with S4HANA for Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

We‚Äôve successfully created a Subaccount for SAP GRDC and established trust with the respective tenant. All relevant roles have been assigned to ABCD ID, and the destination for GRDC has also been configured.

However, during the connection test, we‚Äôre encountering a 302 error. 

In S4HANA Side :

We have created Communication User, Communication System and Communication Arrangement (SAP_COMM_0241).We are referring the SAP Document for this (Step 7).


But while we click on Manage Packages, we are getting  this error :

Can't get the global parameters from the SAP S/4HANA system. Can't retrieve the definition for destinations S4HanaCConsoEndpoint or S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_RFC: Failed to read authentication token of destination 'S4HanaCConsoEndpoint'. The destination service responded with an error: 'Provided authorization grant is invalid. Exception was No user found with alias 'ABCD@xyz.com' (format: unspecified). For more information, consult the kernel traces or the OAuth 2.0 trouble shooting SAP note 1688545'. In case only the properties of a destination should be accessed, without performing authorization flows, please use the 'getDestinationProperties' method on 'DestinationService' instead..


FUNCTIONAL_EXCEPTION Can't retrieve the definition for destinations S4HanaCConsoEndpoint or S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_RFC: Failed to read authentication token of destination 'S4HanaCConsoEndpoint'. The destination service responded with an error: 'Provided authorization grant is invalid. Exception was No user found with alias 'ABCD@xyz.com' (format: unspecified). For more information, consult the kernel traces or the OAuth 2.0 trouble shooting SAP note 1688545'. In case only the properties of a destination should be accessed, without performing authorization flows, please use the 'getDestinationProperties' method on 'DestinationService' instead.

While we click on Define Data Mapping :
We got this error (Can't load the metadata from the SAP S/4HANA system.
Contact your system administrator with this log ID: )

This issue is blocking further progress, and resolving it is critical due to multiple dependencies.

Please help us with this.

Thanks in advance.

Antra Ansari

entry.title: Re: Serial Number in Storage Bin Location
entry.content:
Hello @Charisma_fitra 

Legacy stock lacking serial numbers cannot be converted.

To separate it, you can either:

  • Move it into a different storage location to keep it apart from new SN-managed stock, or
  • Post a goods issue and then re-receipt it with serial numbers.

This ensures clear separation between old and new stock.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Error occurred while integrating SAP GRDC with S4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @897654208074 

The error you are experiencing relates to the OAuth 2.0 trust configuration and destination alias mapping between your SAP BTP subaccount hosting GRDC and your SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud  tenant. A 302 redirect or the no user found with alias message suggests that although the destination can access the S/4HANA system, the problem lies in the identity alias mapping during authentication.

Key Checks to Troubleshoot This Issue.

Communication Setup in SAP S/4HANA:

    • Make sure that the communication scenario SAP_COM_0241 (Consolidation ‚Äì Data Collection Integration) is created.
    • The relevant Communication User must be actively engaged and properly assigned.
    • Authentication method should be set to OAuth 2.0, not Basic Authentication.

Trust Setup Between BTP and S/4HANA:

    • In your SAP BTP subaccount, under Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration, verify that the S/4HANA tenant is trusted as an Identity Provider.
    • Verify that the user alias SAP@HANA.com exists and is mapped correctly to an S/4 user.
    • On the S/4HANA side, verify the Business User maintenance to ensure the user ID and email are consistent and linked to the Communication User.

Destination Configuration in SAP BTP Cockpit:

    • Verify that destinations like S4HanaCConsoEndpoint and S4HanaCConsoEndpoint_RFC use authentication type OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion.
    • Confirm the Token Service URL Type is set to Dedicated.
    • Ensure the audience and client ID match exactly with the S/4HANA Communication System settings.
    • Test the connection from the BTP Cockpit to verify metadata retrieval.

Role assignments in SAP S/4HANA Cloud:

    • The Communication User must have roles that permit Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) API calls, such as the SAP_FIN_BC_CONS_TMC_PC catalogue assigned through Maintain Business Roles.

Frequent mistake:
The message No user found with alias usually indicates that the alias configured in the destination cannot be found in the S/4HANA Identity Provider. Make sure the alias/email matches exactly as propagated from BTP to S/4HANA.

For detailed configuration, please refer to the official SAP Help on Configure Communication Management for GRDC Integration.

KBA 1688545 ‚Äì OAuth 2.0 Troubleshooting Guide 

Setting up an SAP Best Practices Integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

Please inform me if you require any further assistance or support.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: "Build work zone, standard subscription" creation error on BTP Trial account.
entry.content:
I have a BTP trial account. I need to have "Build work zone, standard subscription" to manage my ABAP backend and consume RAP API with Expressjs. Because I need a communication scenario (inbound and authorization) available in Launchpad which can be configured in Build Work Zone normally. To have a Build Work Zone subscription when I click to create and then standard subscription, getting this error: 

You haven't configured your subaccount (for business users) to trust a tenant of SAP Cloud Identity Services using OpenID Connect. SAML trust isn't supported for this service. To subscribe this application, use the Establish Trust option to configure trust between your subaccount and SAP Cloud Identity Services.

I have just default identity provider as user and in Trust Configuration I find just one record which includes name: Default Identity Provider protocol: OpenID Connect. There are no other Trust in this section.

I have read about migration of SAML to OpenID Connect, but I don't see any SAML Trust above mentioned and thus no Tenant names are there. (I tried also a SAML Trust to create but it requires choosing tenant).

Just want to consume some data from a backend. That's all. It shouldn't be that hard. I did this before in NodeJs many times, also in other technologies.

Any help, recommendation appreciated. Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Calling SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 API from SAP Build: A Quick Fix Guide
entry.content:
Hey folks,

Just wanted to share a quick post about a recent issue I ran into while working with SAP Build Actions and SAP AI Core‚Äôs Orchestration v2 API ‚Äî specifically the completion endpoint. This will be a short and to-the-point blog post for anyone hitting similar roadblocks trying to configure an action in SAP Build to call this API.

Let me break it down into three parts:

1. The Problem

I was trying to configure an SAP Build action to call the /completion method from the SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 API.

Now, normally this is quite straightforward ‚Äî just grab the API specification JSON file from the SAP Business Accelerator Hub and upload it using the SAP Build wizard. But in this case, things didn‚Äôt go as planned.

Here‚Äôs what happened:

  • The completion method didn‚Äôt show up in the wizard.
  • I tried uploading the API spec file manually ‚Äî this time it showed the method. Great!
  • But once I used the provided example from the API doc to test it, I got hit with a 400 error üòë



2. Why the Standard Way Doesn‚Äôt Work

Turns out, the schema and the example JSON in the API documentation don‚Äôt match. So even though the wizard technically accepts the API file, SAP Build complains when you try to use the provided example.

From what I observed, it looks like the schema or example might have been copied from v1 or has some leftover data that doesn‚Äôt match v2 requirements. Either way ‚Äî we‚Äôre stuck unless we intervene manually.

3. The Fix: Manual Configuration & Correct Payload

Since I couldn‚Äôt rely on the official schema and example, I took a more DIY approach.

Step 1: Clean up the payload

First, I stripped down the example JSON to just the mandatory fields to pass SAP Build‚Äôs schema validation. That helped temporarily, but when I actually hit the API, I got a new error saying:

"Missing required field: orchestration_config"

So, clearly the schema itself was also incomplete.

‚ùóQuick Detour: Tried AI Launchpad for Help

At this point, I thought of checking the SAP AI Launchpad in BTP to get the real orchestration configuration JSON. That would be the natural place to find the actual payload, right?

But unfortunately, the orchestration config shown in AI Launchpad of subaccount is identical to what was already in the API specification file ‚Äî so no luck there either. üòÖ


Step 2: Find a correct schema

Luckily, I found this tutorial which had a bruno_collection file. I searched for the completion method and found the json schema with the orchestration_config keyword included.

 


Here's a snippet:

{
  "orchestration_config": {
    "module_configurations": {
      "grounding_module_config": {
        ...
      },
      ...
    }
  },
  "input_params": {
    "groundingRequest": "what is joule?"
  },
  "return_module_results": true
}


Step 3: Configure SAP Build

At this point, you can either remove the action and

  • Build from scratch
  • Or continue with the existing action and replace the faulty input key with the corrected one


If you face a similar issue with output structure, you can follow the same logic ‚Äî update the output schema manually to match the real response you‚Äôre getting.

And finally‚Ä¶ üí•

It works! üéâ


Final Thoughts

So, if you‚Äôre trying to call the SAP AI Core Orchestration v2 /completion API from SAP Build and the standard flow isn‚Äôt working ‚Äî don‚Äôt worry. It‚Äôs not you, it‚Äôs the schema üòâ

You‚Äôll likely need to:

  • Skip the API wizard
  • Use the correct payload from the tutorial
  • Manually configure your action with fixed request and response schemas

Let me know in the comments if you ran into the same issue or found a better workaround! I‚Äôd love to learn how you approached it too.

Thanks for reading üôå

entry.title: Re: "Build work zone, standard subscription" creation error on BTP Trial account.
entry.content:
I really lost what you are trying to achieve when you said that you want to use "Build work zone, standard subscription" to manage my ABAP backend and consume RAP API with Expressjs and later when you say " I need a communication scenario (inbound and authorization) available in Launchpad" and finally "Just want to consume some data from a backend. (...) I did this before in NodeJs many times, also in other technologies." 

Reading this makes me wonder if you know that Work Zone standard edition will offer you. It's only a launchpad in BTP. There is no management of ABAP or consumption of APIs using Express or any inbound communication. 

But let's go for the facts.

  • Using a the identity provider is possible (however not recommended)
  • Using a custom identity provider is possible with both SAML and OpenID
  • It's possible to migrate a custom IdP using SAML to OpenID

I'd recommend sharing a little bit more how your trust configuration looks like, how you are trying to create the subscription.

Something important is if you have already a subscription of the Work Zone advanced edition in the same BTP subaccount. Up until recently this was a not recommended and recently I've seen somewhere it should not be an issue anymore but I personally doubt that. The advanced edition works only with a custom IdP.

entry.title: Re: Push notifications using SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hi James/Vladyslav,

Quick follow-up - have either of you successfully enabled push notifications in SAP Build Apps (not MDK/Fiori)? If yes, could you please share step-by-step details? I‚Äôve been trying for months and keep hitting roadblocks.

For context:

  • When I enable Mobile Services, the generated services does not have Push capability and  SAP support has told me this can‚Äôt be enabled for Build Apps.

  • Even on standalone builds, I‚Äôm prompted to enable Mobile Services, and I‚Äôm unclear whether FCM/APNs is actually supported end-to-end with Build Apps.

If you‚Äôve made this work, could you please outline:

  1. Environment & Build

    • iOS, Android, or both?

    • Standalone build (APK/IPA via TestFlight) vs. Preview app.

    • Exact Build Apps runtime/plugin versions used.

  2. Firebase/APNs Setup

    • FCM project config (google-services.json / GoogleService-Info.plist).

    • APNs keys/certificates and provisioning profiles for iOS.

    • Where/how you injected these into the Build Apps project.

  3. Build Apps Configuration

    • Marketplace plugins used (names/versions) for notifications.

    • Any Custom Plugin steps (config.xml, Gradle, Info.plist edits).

    • Logic flow you used: Request Permission ‚Üí Get Token ‚Üí Persist Token.

    • Whether Mobile Services was enabled, and if so, which features.

  4. Token & Backend

    • How you retrieved and stored the device token (BTP CF app, DB, Firebase, etc.).

    • How you send pushes (FCM HTTP v1 / APNs) ‚Äî sample request payloads helpful.

    • Any security (service accounts, OAuth) specifics.

entry.title: Production process
entry.content:
Good morning,
I have a question about how to carry out the following process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition.
Can you help me recommend the best practice for the following scenario?

1.The customer has rods in this example they identified as V001X6000M.

2.The complete rod measures 6 meters.

 

3.However, the customer sells the rod according to the measurement requested by the customer, and can sell the complete rod as "n" measurement requested by the customer.

4.For example, a client requires 1 meter, currently in his system he outputs the code V001X6000M which has the 6 meters and enters two new codes V001X1000M (the measurement requested from the client) and V001X5000M (the excess of the rod that can be reused).

5. The client wants to carry out this process using the PRODUCTION process, but I'm encountering several limitations.
For example, their bill of materials, if I handle the product in either PIECES OR METERS, let's say my customer order is for two pieces measuring 2 meters each.

When creating my production order, the system will create an order for two pieces of V001X6000M when in reality, one piece is sufficient because it measures 6 meters.

What have you recommended in this type of scenario, how to implement this process in SAP?
Have you implemented it in the production module?
Or is this type of scenario not recommended for production?

The option I'm considering is to manage batches. This way, I would output one batch with a 6m measurement and input two new batches with the new measurements, in order to reduce the creation of materials in SAP. The base unit of measurement that I am recommending is PIECE and in batch specify the measurement, in this way you will be able to know the quantity of pieces with the exact measurement that the batch number will be indicating.

I would greatly appreciate your comments if you have any additional suggestions.

Thank you so much.

entry.title: Re: Statistical Projects in SAP PS
entry.content:
The best practice for a purely "statistical" project is to use WBS elements only.  Network Activities cannot be set as Statistical, only WBS can be set Statistical.

Think of it like this, when you post an actual P&L cost you must assign it to a "real" cost object and in parallel you can also assign the cost to a statistical object.  WBS, Internal Orders, or Cost Centers can be set as statistical.

You can use Budget Availability Control with a Statistical WBS.

entry.title: How to get threshold value details per metric then send to Outbound Integration?
entry.content:
Dear support, we are searching for information if there is method to easily get threshold values per metric that raised an alert into outbound integration with badi enh ( eg. IF_ACC_MEA -> methods GET_....)


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to get threshold value details per metric then se...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Thank you for reaching out.

Upon further review, I would like to clarify that the interface `IF_ACC_MEA` does not provide a standard method to retrieve metric threshold details associated with the alerts. You can refer to page 14 of the guide linked below, which outlines all the supported out-of-the-box Get methods:  

https://support.sap.com/content/dam/support/en_us/library/ssp/alm/sap-solution-manager/focused-solutions/FocusedRun-Alert-Consumer-BAdI-Interface.pdf  

To access the threshold data, you will need to implement custom code. The following resources can assist you in identifying where these threshold details are stored:  

  1. For a specific Managed Object and metric, obtain the MO ID and Metric ID by referring to KBA 2515250, which is also applicable to FRUN.  
  2. Using the MO ID and Metric ID, retrieve the threshold type (`RULE_TYPE`) from the table `ACRULETYPESDIR`.  
  3. With the threshold type, run transaction SE80->package: AI_SOLMAN_ALRT_CFG_RULETYPES->Dictionary objects->database tables:
       - `ACALREADYRATED` ‚Äì "Already Rated" rule configuration  
       - `ACBESTOFLASTN` ‚Äì "Best of last n" rule configuration  
       - `ACCOUNTERTHRESH` ‚Äì Counter threshold  
       - `ACDELTATHRESH` ‚Äì Delta threshold  
       - `ACPCTHRESDIR` ‚Äì Alert configuration: database table for percentage threshold  
       - `ACRANGETHRESHDIR` ‚Äì Database table for range threshold configuration data  
       - `ACSIMPLETHRESDIR` ‚Äì Alert configuration: database table for simple thresholds  
       - `ACTEXTTHRESHOLD` ‚Äì Rule type text threshold  
       - `ACTHRESHOLDLESS` ‚Äì Threshold less rule configuration  

These tables contain further details on the specific thresholds, including numeric values and associated texts. 

Best regards,

Ava

SAP Support

entry.title: Tracking customer-owned RMAs in ECC
entry.content:
I am a user, not an architect. We are still running an older version of ECC with a roadmap to begin kick off our S4 HANA project in 2026. 

I have an urgent need for ideas how to track Customer-owned RMAs in our current version of SAP.  

Once goods receipt is performed, we can move it in MIGO with 311E movement type. The issue we have: the material is repaired in a plant different than the GR is performed. I want to track the physical location of the RMA in SAP while moved between plants. My IT group does not have a solution to move Customer-owned material across plants. 

Anyone have ideas how to track this material across plants that will not require huge amounts of IT resources, otherwise it will get pushed to the S4 project?

Also, does S4 Hana have a solution for this? 

Thanks in advance

entry.title: Re: Completing Learning Journey over several Practice Sys...
entry.content: I re-enrolled in one practice system 1 or two time with no loss of data. Just my experience as a developer.
